TextView.android:text: Questions about in-toeing and out-toeing are among of the most common reasons parents bring their children to see a pediatric orthopedist. The child's parents and often, even more so, the child's grandparents want to know if the way their child walks is normal and if the in-toeing will cause the child to fall more often. Many parents or other relatives were treated with special shoes or bars for a problem they had with their legs when they were young. Today, more often than not, treatment is not necessary thanks to a better understanding of what causes in-toeing and out-toeing and how these conditions get better over time. In-toeing arises from one of, or a combination of, three areas: the foot, the leg, or around the hip. Which area contributes to the in-toeing determines the likelihood that it will be corrected over time and determines up until what age one may expect improvement.
Hence, there’s a great need for a device that can help alleviate this problem without surgery. This is exactly what StraightGait device stands for.
